decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The erection of a hip to gable roof extension and rear roof extension and insertion of x1 side with at roof level would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 2 - The insert of x2 rooflights to front roofslope would consist of any other alteration to the roof of the dwelling house within the meaning of Class C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class C. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 3 - The development is only just within Permitted Development tolerances in terms of volume. You are advised to complete the development in full accordance with the plans, as if the development is larger than that covered by this Certificate a breach of planning control could result.

Condition : 4 - INFORMATIVE: The applicant is advised that the proposed side window at roof level must be obscure glazed (frosted) and non-opening above the floor or the stair immediately below the centre of the window in order to comply with B.2 (c), Schedule 2, Part 1, Class B of the GPDO 2015 (as amended).

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE
Building Regulations 
Please note that this is a planning permission only and you may also require approval under the Building Regulations. If you are in any doubt about this you can get further information via https://www.merton.gov.uk/planning-and-buildings/building-control  or by emailing building.control@merton.gov.uk.

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE
The applicant should be aware that the site may provide a useful habitat for swifts. Swifts are currently in decline in the UK and in order to encourage and improve the conservation of swifts the applicant is advised to consider the installation of swift nesting box/bricks on site.
description: APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESPECT OF THE PROPOSED ERECTION OF A HIP TO GABLE EXTENSION AND REAR DORMER ROOF EXTENSION WITH X2 ROOFLIGHTS TO FRONT ROOFSLOPE.
